    • Constructor Detail

      • GroovyScriptExecuter

        public GroovyScriptExecuter()
        The constructor is being called from the system during login. It initializes the EventHandler with some helpful information which is stored in a TPersonBean and a SessionBean.

        The user and session bean contain information such as user name, user e-mail, user preferred locale, last login, the ApplicationBean containing the application context, and much more.

        Access to the persistence layer can be obtained via the static DAOFactory class like this:
          ...
          DAOFactory fact = DAOFactory.getFactory();
          WorkItemDAO widao = fact.getWorkItemDAO();
          ...

    • Method Detail

      • handleEvent

      • getParameterInstanceGroovyHandler

        public static java.lang.Object getParameterInstanceGroovyHandler(java.lang.String handlerClass,
                                                 java.lang.String methodName)
        Helper method for parameter classes. The "parameter" script are probably changed according to the customer needs while the logic scripts are relative stable (probably not changed by the customer) If the parameter script is changed (and automatically recompiled) the original "parameter" class file seems to remain in the Groovy classpath. In the local GroovyScriptLoader cache (availableClasses map) the actual version is stored That's why in the logic scripts the parameter script's fields/methods shouldn't be accessed directly (it contains the old version of the class from the Groovy classpath) but from the GroovyScriptLoader cache through reflection.
        Parameters:
        handlerClass -
        methodName -
        Returns:

      • executeGroovyHandler

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> executeGroovyHandler(java.lang.String handlerClass,
                                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> inputBinding)
        If something goes wrong here the returnBinding is unchanged, that is the regular action commences.

      • executeActivityScript

        public static java.util.List<ErrorData> executeActivityScript(java.lang.String handlerClass,
                                              WorkItemContext workItemContext,
                                              TPersonBean personBean)
        Executes the Groovy script activity 1. may modify the workItemBean before save 2. may return list of ErrorData in the returnBinding map containing "errorList" as key. If the list is not empty then the issue will not be saved but the error message will be shown as a validation error
        Parameters:
        handlerClass -
        workItemContext -
        personBean -
        Returns:

      • executeGuardScript

        public static boolean executeGuardScript(java.lang.String handlerClass,
                         TWorkItemBean workItemBean,
                         java.lang.Integer personID,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> inputBinding)
        Executes the Groovy script guard. If the guard is not satisfied then the script should set the guardPassed boolean value to false in the return binding
        Parameters:
        handlerClass -
        workItemBean -
        personID -
        inputBinding - context coming from specific source (e-mail)
        Returns:

      • executeLdapScript

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> executeLdapScript(java.lang.String handlerClass,
                                                                 TSiteBean siteBean,
                                                                 java.lang.String filter)
        Executes the Groovy script guard. If the guard is not satisfied then the script should set the "reject" boolean value in the return binding
        Parameters:
        handlerClass - the Groovy handler class
        siteBean - the TSiteBean object for this Genji instance
        filter - the LDAP filter expression for the search
        Returns:
        a single HashMap <"map", HashMap (login name, TPersonBean)>
